Carousel

Ian Lyttle

2016-12-27

library("gapminder")
library("ggplot2")
library("bsplus")
library("gganimate")
tmp <- 
  ggplot(gapminder, aes(gdpPercap, lifeExp, size = pop, frame = continent)) +
  geom_point() +
  scale_x_log10()

tmp2 <- ggplot2::ggplot_build(tmp)

tmp3 <- gganimate(tmp)

S3 Class

bs_carousel(id, use_indicators, use_controls)
bs_append(tag, content, caption)
bs_carousel_caption(title, body) #helper

Example

library("htmltools")

bs_carousel("the_beatles") %>%
  bs_append(
    content = img(src = "img/john.png", alt = "John Lennon"),
    caption = bs_carousel_caption("John Lennon", "Rhythm guitar, vocals")
  ) %>%
  bs_append_img(
    content = img(src = "img/paul.png", alt = "Paul McCartney"),
    caption = bs_carousel_caption("Paul McCartney", "Bass guitar, vocals")
  ) %>%
  bs_append_img(
    content = img(src = "img/george.png", alt = "George Harrison"),
    caption = bs_carousel_caption("George Harrison", "Lead guitar, vocals")
  ) %>%
  bs_append_img(
    content = img(src = "img/ringo.png", alt = "Ringo Starr"),
    caption = bs_carousel_caption("Ringo Starr", "Drums, vocals")
  )

Let’s say we have a dataframe with columns:

  • src, relative path to image from file
  • alt, (optional) character, alternative text
  • caption, (optional) HTML for captions

Also, think about how to incorporate this with gganimate

Developed by Ian Lyttle, Schneider Electric.
